plurally adverb
(GRAMMAR)
Add to word list
Add to word list
language
  specialized using the form of a word that expresses more than one: The word "sheep" refers both singularly and plurally to a type of farm animal. This word is often used plurally.
More examplesFewer examplesThe word is only used in the singular, and not plurally.The word "politics" can be used plurally as well as singularly. When used plurally, "the heavens" refers to the sky.

plurally adverb
(DIFFERENT WAYS/PEOPLE)
by more than one person or thing: Almost all artistic projects are now plurally funded. The Bible is a plurally authored text.
